dublin_core.dcvalue: Greenland has a geography and demography that make telemedicine a logical choice when planning a future public health service Telemedicine was introduced in 1994 Although everybody considered it to be a good idea it took five years to move from initial enthusiasm to politicians and officials committing the necessary resources Over such a long period there is a risk that good ideas will become neglected although where resources are limited it is useful as a time in which to select the best of the new ideas We have certainly gained a great deal of experience which we will use if and when over the next two years we have to argue for an extension of our business plan
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T12:29:30Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2000-05-25
Telemedicine in Greenland--from the early beginnings to the making of a business plan.
